page.title: 17Gressingham
page.content: The small village of Gressingham is situated on the West bank of the River Lune some 2 km from Hornby. The two villages are connected by a road which spans the river at the Loyne Bridge, a single track width:-proceed with caution! Gressingham's inhabitants are clustered together around the church and the whole village appears to cling to the hillside on which it is situated. There are no amenities in the village; the residents have to travel to shop, attend school, collect pensions, etc. There is a small unlicensed restaurant which is well known locally for its roast duckling! Gressingham's 150 inhabitants are suitably proud of their village because in July 1985 they won the small villages section of Lancashire's Best Kept Village competition.
